verses.verse: Now it came<WH1961> about in the fourteenth<WH702> <WH6240> year<WH8141> of King<WH4428> Hezekiah,<WH2396> Sennacherib<WH5576> king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> came<WH5927> up against<WH5921> all<WH3605> the fortified<WH1219> cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063> and seized<WH8610> them.

And the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> sent<WH7971> Rabshakeh<WH7262> from Lachish<WH3923> to Jerusalem<WH3389> to King<WH4428> Hezekiah<WH2396> with a large<WH3515> army.<WH2428> And he stood<WH5975> by the conduit<WH8585> of the upper<WH5945> pool<WH1295> on the highway<WH4546> of the fuller's field.<WH7704>

Then Eliakim<WH471> the son<WH1121> of Hilkiah,<WH2518> who<WH834> was over<WH5921> the household,<WH1004> and Shebna<WH7644> the scribe,<WH9373> and Joah<WH3098> the son<WH1121> of Asaph,<WH623> the recorder,<WH2142> came<WH3318> out to him.

Then Rabshakeh<WH7262> said<WH559> to them, "Say<WH559> now<WH4994> to Hezekiah,<WH2396> 'Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the great<WH1419> king,<WH4428> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> "What<WH4100> is this<WH2088> confidence<WH986> that you have<WH982>?

"I say,<WH559> 'Your counsel<WH6098> and strength<WH1369> for the war<WH4421> are only<WH389> empty<WH8193> words.<WH1697>' Now<WH6258> on whom<WH4310> do you rely,<WH982> that you have rebelled<WH4775> against me?

"Behold,<WH2009> you rely<WH982> on the staff<WH4938> of this<WH2088> crushed<WH7533> reed,<WH7070> [even] on Egypt;<WH4714> on which<WH834> if a man<WH376> leans,<WH5564> it will go<WH935> into his hand<WH3709> and pierce<WH9344> it. So<WH3651> is Pharaoh<WH6547> king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> to all<WH3605> who rely<WH982> on him.

"But if<WH3588> you say<WH559> to me, 'We trust<WH982> in the Lord<WH3068> our God,<WH430>' is it not He whose<WH834> high<WH1116> places<WH1116> and whose altars<WH4196> Hezekiah<WH2396> has taken<WH5493> away,<WH5493> and has said<WH559> to Judah<WH3063> and to Jerusalem,<WH3389> 'You shall worship<WH7812> before<WH6440> this<WH2088> altar<WH4196>'?

"Now<WH6258> therefore, come<WH4994> make<WH6148> a bargain<WH6148> with my master<WH113> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> and I will give<WH5414> you two thousand<WH505> horses,<WH5483> if<WH518> you are able<WH3201> on your part to set<WH5414> riders<WH7392> on them.

"How<WH349> then can you repulse<WH7725> <WH6440> one<WH259> official<WH6346> of the least<WH6996> of my master's servants,<WH5650> and rely<WH982> on Egypt<WH4714> for chariots<WH7393> and for horsemen<WH6571>?

"And have I now<WH6258> come<WH5927> up without<WH1107> the Lord<WH3068>'s approval against<WH5921> this<WH384> land<WH776> to destroy<WH7843> it? The Lord said<WH559> to me, 'Go<WH5927> up against<WH413> this<WH384> land,<WH776> and destroy<WH7843> it.'"' "

Then Eliakim<WH471> and Shebna<WH7644> and Joah<WH3098> said<WH559> to Rabshakeh,<WH7262> "Speak<WH1696> now<WH4994> to your servants<WH5650> in Aramaic,<WH762> for we understand<WH8085> [it]; and do not speak<WH1696> with us in Judean,<WH3066> in the hearing<WH241> of the people<WH5971> who<WH834> are on the wall.<WH2346>"

But Rabshakeh<WH7262> said,<WH559> "Has my master<WH113> sent<WH7971> me only to your master<WH113> and to you to speak<WH1696> these<WH428> words,<WH1697> [and] not to the men<WH376> who sit<WH3427> on the wall,<WH2346> [doomed] to eat<WH398> their own dung<WH2716> and drink<WH8354> their own urine<WH7890> with you?"

Then Rabshakeh<WH7262> stood<WH5975> and cried<WH7121> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963> in Judean,<WH3066> and said,<WH559> "Hear<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of the great<WH1419> king,<WH4428> the king<WH4428> of Assyria.<WH804>
"Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the king,<WH4428> 'Do not let Hezekiah<WH2396> deceive<WH5378> you, for he will not be able<WH3201> to deliver<WH5337> you;

nor<WH408> let Hezekiah<WH2396> make you trust<WH982> in the Lord,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> "The Lord<WH3068> will surely<WH5337> deliver<WH5337> us, this<WH384> city<WH5892> shall not be given<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria.<WH804>"

'Do not listen<WH8085> to Hezekiah,<WH2396>' for thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> 'Make<WH6213> your peace<WH1293> with me and come<WH3318> out to me, and eat<WH398> each<WH376> of his vine<WH1612> and each<WH376> of his fig<WH8384> tree<WH8384> and drink<WH8354> each<WH376> of the waters<WH4325> of his own cistern,<WH953>

until<WH5704> I come<WH935> and take<WH3947> you away to a land<WH776> like your own land,<WH776> a land<WH776> of grain<WH1715> and new<WH8492> wine,<WH8492> a land<WH776> of bread<WH3899> and vineyards.<WH3754>

'[Beware] lest<WH6435> Hezekiah<WH2396> misleads<WH5496> you, saying,<WH559> "The Lord<WH3068> will deliver<WH5337> us." Has any<WH376> one<WH376> of the gods<WH430> of the nations<WH1471> delivered<WH5337> his land<WH776> from the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804>?

'Where<WH346> are the gods<WH430> of Hamath<WH2574> and Arpad<WH774>? Where<WH346> are the gods<WH430> of Sepharvaim<WH5617>? And when<WH3588> have they delivered<WH5337> Samaria<WH8111> from my hand<WH3027>?

'Who<WH4310> among all<WH3605> the gods<WH430> of these<WH428> lands<WH776> have delivered<WH5337> their land<WH776> from my hand,<WH3027> that the Lord<WH3068> should deliver<WH5337> Jerusalem<WH3389> from my hand<WH3027>?' "
But they were silent<WH2790> and answered<WH6030> him not a word;<WH1697> for the king's commandment<WH4687> was, "Do not answer<WH6030> him."

Then Eliakim<WH471> the son<WH1121> of Hilkiah,<WH2518> who<WH834> was over<WH5921> the household,<WH1004> and Shebna<WH7644> the scribe<WH9373> and Joah<WH3098> the son<WH1121> of Asaph,<WH623> the recorder,<WH2142> came<WH935> to Hezekiah<WH2396> with their clothes<WH899> torn<WH7167> and told<WH5046> him the words<WH1697> of Rabshakeh.<WH7262>
